item.0: A man's sense of true fulfillment is deeply rooted in him being loved by a women."
item.1: Some women, while advocating for 'equality,' may actually be aiming for preferential treatment, like hiring practices that prioritize them over men.
item.2: In times of crisis, women's survival ought not necessarily to be prioritized over men's.
item.3: Many women tend to perceive harmless comments or actions as expressions of sexism.
item.4: Women have a tendency to be too quick to take offense.
item.5: Happiness and fulfillment can be achieved without the need for a romantic partnership.
item.6: Feminists are not aiming for women to dominate men.
item.7: Many women possess a degree of moral integrity that is relatively rare among men.
item.8: Men should provide a safe and nurturing environment for women.
item.9: Most women do not fully recognize or value everything that men do for them.
item.10: Women often attempt to exert influence over men to achieve their own goals.
item.11: A men ought to have a special woman by his side.
item.12: Men do not need women to be whole.
item.13: Women tend to dramatize the issues they face in the workplace.
item.14: Once a woman has a man emotionally hooked, she often becomes possessive and controlling.
item.15: When men win in a competition against women, women often attribute their loss to unfair circumstances.
item.16: A good woman should be cherished and worshiped by her partner.
item.17: It is fairly uncommon for women to pretend to be flattered by men's advances when in reality they're just playing hard to get.
item.18: Compared to men, women are often perceived to have a heightened sense of moral awareness.
item.19: Men should put the financial needs of the women in their lives before their own happiness and comfort.
item.20: The demands feminists are making of men are entirely fair and justified.
item.21: Compared to men, women are often regarded as having a more sophisticated appreciation for culture and aesthetics.
